The new password manager is more difficult to use than the "traditional" format.  Under the "traditional" format, in order to view passwords, the user had to enter the master password one time.  Then all passwords for sites could be seen until the password manager was closed.  The new version requires the master password to be entered for each site.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open password manager and select a domain.
2.select view password and enter the master password.
3.select a different domain and repeat #2.


Expected Results:  
Entering the Master Password in order to view site passwords should only be required one time.

comments.raw_text: When selecting [Tools > Data Manager] or any other tool except Password Manager, the master password should not be requested.  The master password should be requested -- providing it was not already entered for the current session -- only if the user selects "Passwords only" from the data selection list or the Passwords tab.

Good news from the Seamonkey support mailing list.  The solution to this problem has always been available in Seamonkey.

The traditional password manager is contained in "omni.jar" which is a zip archive in the Seamonkey program directory.

Enter the url: "chrome://communicator/content/passwordManager.xul"
Create a bookmark and use that to access the traditional password manager.

Please keep this is future versions of Seamonkey.
